org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common

Class SchedulerConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.authentication.Connection<SchedulerAuthenticationInterface>
      • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.SchedulerConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Loggable

    @PublicAPI
public class SchedulerConnection
extends Connection<SchedulerAuthenticationInterface>
    Start here, it provides a method to join an existing scheduler.
    The method join(String) returns a SchedulerAuthenticationInterface in order to give the scheduler the possibility to authenticate user that wants to connect a scheduler.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getInstance

        public static SchedulerConnection getInstance()
        Get the instance of the Scheduler connection
        Returns:
        the instance of the Scheduler connection

      • join

        public static SchedulerAuthenticationInterface join(String url)
                                             throws ConnectionException
        Returns the SchedulerAuthenticationInterface from the specified URL. If scheduler is not available or initializing throws an exception.
        Note that you can use the provided SchedulerAuthenticationGUIHelper class to display a graphical interface that will ask the URL, login and password.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the scheduler to join.
        Returns:
        the scheduler authentication at the specified URL.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if connection is not possible on the given URL.

      • waitAndJoin

        public static SchedulerAuthenticationInterface waitAndJoin(String url)
                                                    throws ConnectionException
        Connects to the scheduler using given URL. The current thread will be block until connection established or an error occurs.
        Note that you can use the provided SchedulerAuthenticationGUIHelper class to display a graphical interface that will ask the URL, login and password.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the scheduler to join.
        Returns:
        the interface to be authenticate by the Scheduler
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if connection is not possible on the given URL.

      • waitAndJoin

        public static SchedulerAuthenticationInterface waitAndJoin(String url,
                                                           long timeout)
                                                    throws ConnectionException
        Connects to the scheduler with a specified timeout value. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. The connection will then block until established or an error occurs.
        Note that you can use the provided SchedulerAuthenticationGUIHelper class to display a graphical interface that will ask the URL, login and password.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the scheduler to join.
        timeout - the amount of time during which it will try to join the Scheduler
        Returns:
        the interface to be authenticate by the Scheduler
        Throws:
        ConnectionException
